bugs.title: CVE-2024-11110 chromium: Inappropriate implementation in Extensions [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-11110 chromium: Inappropriate implementation in Extensions [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-11110 chromium-browser: Inappropriate implementation in Extensions

long_desc.thetext: Inappropriate implementation in Extensions in Google Chrome prior to 131.0.6778.69 allowed a remote attacker to bypass site isolation via a crafted Chrome Extension. (Chromium security severity: High)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2325747

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-11111 chromium: Inappropriate implementation in Autofill [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-11111 chromium: Inappropriate implementation in Autofill [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-11111 chromium-browser: Inappropriate implementation in Autofill

long_desc.thetext: Inappropriate implementation in Autofill in Google Chrome prior to 131.0.6778.69 allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to engage in specific UI gestures to perform UI spoofing via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2325736

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-11113 chromium: Use after free in Accessibility [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-11113 chromium: Use after free in Accessibility [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-11113 chromium-browser: Use after free in Accessibility

long_desc.thetext: Use after free in Accessibility in Google Chrome prior to 131.0.6778.69 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2325729

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

notes:
Update to 131.0.6778.85

      * High CVE-2024-11395: Type Confusion in V8
      * High CVE-2024-11110: Inappropriate implementation in Blink
      * Medium CVE-2024-11111: Inappropriate implementation in Autofill
      * Medium CVE-2024-11112: Use after free in Media
      * Medium CVE-2024-11113: Use after free in Accessibility
      * Medium CVE-2024-11114: Inappropriate implementation in Views
      * Medium CVE-2024-11115: Insufficient policy enforcement in Navigation
      * Medium CVE-2024-11116: Inappropriate implementation in Paint
      * Low CVE-2024-11117: Inappropriate implementation in FileSystem
